title: SALES REP
description:
Bluescripts is expanding its operations into CNG (Compressed Natural Gas) vehicle conversion services, and we are seeking a dynamic and results\-driven **Sales Executive** to drive sales and market penetration across Nigeria. The ideal candidate will be responsible for generating leads, closing sales, and building strong relationships with vehicle owners, fleet operators, and businesses looking to switch to CNG for cost savings and environmental benefits.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Sales \& Business Development:** Identify and engage potential customers, including individual vehicle owners, transport companies, corporate fleets, and government agencies interested in CNG conversion.
* **Lead Generation \& Conversion:** Develop and execute sales strategies to drive conversions, meet sales targets, and expand market reach.
* **Customer Relationship Management:** Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, providing consultation on the benefits of CNG and addressing customer concerns.
* **Market Research \& Strategy:** Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer needs to develop effective sales strategies.
* **Partnership Development:** Collaborate with auto workshops, transport associations, and government agencies to create awareness and drive sales.
* **Sales Presentations \& Demonstrations:** Conduct product demonstrations, presentations, and training sessions for potential clients.
* **Reporting \& Performance Tracking:** Maintain accurate sales records and reports to track performance and inform decision\-making.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum ofOND/ **HND** in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field.
* **2\+ years** of experience in sales, preferably in automotive, energy, or industrial sectors.
* Strong understanding of **CNG technology** and its benefits (training will be provided).
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and persuasion skills.
* Proven ability to **achieve and exceed sales targets**.
* Strong networking and relationship\-building skills.
* Self\-motivated, proactive, and results\-oriented.
* Ability to travel and work independently.
* Knowledge of the Nigerian automotive and transportation industry is an added advantage.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary with attractive commissions.
* Training and career growth opportunities.
* Opportunity to work with a fast\-growing company in the sustainable energy sector.

**How to Apply:**  
Interested candidates should send their CVs and cover letters to **bluescriptslagos@gmail.com or info@bluescriptstech.com**  with the subject **"Sales Executive – CNG Conversion"**.

Job Type: Part\-time

Pay: ₦50,000\.00 \- ₦100,000\.00 per month

Expected hours: 5 – 10 per week

Expected Start Date: 31/03/2025

title: Sales Representative
description:
**Job Title: Sales Representative**

**Company: Mighty DemoLex Publishers**

**Location:** Ibadan, Ilorin, Akure, Osogbo, Ado\-Ekiti

**About Mighty DemoLex Publishers:** Mighty DemoLex Publishers is a leading publishing company committed to delivering quality publications to readers across the country. As part of our expansion plans, we are looking to hire talented and motivated Sales Representatives to help us extend our reach and grow our brand.

**Position Overview:** We are seeking dynamic and result\-oriented Sales Representatives to represent Mighty DemoLex Publishers in various regions, including Ibadan, Ilorin, Akure, Osogbo, and Ado\-Ekiti. As a Sales Representative, you will be responsible for driving sales, building strong relationships with customers, and contributing to the company's growth and success.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Sales Growth:** Promote and sell Mighty DemoLex Publishers' products, including books and educational materials, to customers within your assigned region.
* **Client Relationship Management:** Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing clients, bookstores, schools, libraries, and other potential customers.
* **Market Expansion:** Identify and engage new customers and markets to increase the company’s presence in the region.
* **Sales Reporting:** Provide regular updates on sales activities, customer feedback, and market trends.
* **Product Knowledge:** Stay up\-to\-date on the latest publications and features of the company’s products to provide accurate and persuasive information to customers.
* **Customer Support:** Address customer inquiries, concerns, and product\-related issues in a timely and professional manner.
* **Sales Targets:** Meet or exceed sales targets and goals set by the company to drive overall success.

**Qualifications \& Requirements:**

* **Education:** Minimum of HND/BSC in any relevant field.
* **Experience:** Previous sales experience is a plus, especially in the publishing or related industry.
* **Driver’s License:** A valid driver's license is required as the role may involve travel within your assigned region.
* **Skills:**
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to negotiate and close deals.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Self\-motivated, target\-driven, and results\-oriented.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* **Attributes:**
* Energetic and enthusiastic with a passion for sales.
* Detail\-oriented with a proactive approach to problem\-solving.
* Ability to build and maintain long\-term customer relationships.

**What We Offer:**

* A supportive work environment.
* Career growth opportunities.
* The chance to represent a well\-established and respected publisher.
* Competitive compensation package and incentives based on sales performance.

**How to Apply:** If you are a motivated and results\-oriented individual looking for an exciting opportunity to grow your career, we would love to hear from you.

Please send your updated resume to **loveofgodcelebritybooks@gmail.com**.

**Application Deadline:** 31st March, 2025

Join us at Mighty DemoLex Publishers and take the first step towards a rewarding career in sales with a leading publisher!

Job Type: Full\-time

Willingness to travel:

* 25% (Required)

Application Deadline: 31/03/2025

title: Business Development Executive
description:
**Job Title: Business Development Executive**

**Job Type:** Full time

**Location:** Remote

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* **120\-Day Trial Period:** During this period, your performance will be evaluated based on lead generation and customer acquisition.
* **Performance Benchmark:** To be eligible for a full\-time role, you must acquire at least four new customers within the 120\-day trial period.
* **Compensation During Trial:** While in the trial period, you will only receive 15% of the revenue generated from closed sales deals. There will not be any fixed salary but just 15% of the revenue generated from the deal you close (This is recurring as long as the client continues to work with us and pays invoices).
* **Post\-Trial Compensation:** Upon successful completion of the trial period and meeting the customer acquisition target, you will be eligible for a full\-time role with a fixed salary (range ₦250000 \- ₦ 300000\) plus the 15% revenue sharing from closed sales deals will continue even after the trial period.

**About Us:** Metricoid Technology Solutions is a leading software development company specializing in web, mobile, and AI applications. With over 14 years of experience and a global client base, we provide innovative and cost\-effective solutions to startups and enterprises. We are seeking a **Business Development Executive (BDE)** to lead our efforts in acquiring new clients, driving growth, and expanding our presence in the USA and EU markets.

**Role Overview:**

The Business Development Executive will take **end\-to\-end ownership** of our business growth efforts, including strategizing, leading the team, and directly engaging with potential clients. This role requires a proactive leader who can devise strategies, oversee execution, and deliver measurable results in terms of client acquisition and revenue growth.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Strategy Development:**
* Develop and implement a business development strategy targeting USA and EU markets.
* Identify new market opportunities, industries, and client segments.
* **Lead Generation and Client Acquisition:**
* Drive inbound and outbound lead generation through campaigns, networking, and partnerships.
* Build and nurture relationships with potential clients, from initial contact to deal closure.
* **Team Leadership:**
* Manage and mentor a team of marketing and lead generation specialists.
* Ensure alignment between team efforts and business goals.
* **Execution and Accountability:**
* Own the entire sales funnel—from lead generation to closing deals.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a smooth client onboarding process.
* **Market Insights and Reporting:**
* Conduct market research to stay ahead of industry trends and competitors.
* Provide regular updates and reports on progress, challenges, and recommendations.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**
* Minimum **3\+ years of experience** in business development, sales, or a similar leadership role, preferably in a software development or IT services company.
* Proven track record of successfully closing deals in international markets (USA/EU preferred).
* **Skills:**
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship\-building abilities.
* Deep understanding of software development services (AI/ML, MVPs, SaaS, etc.).
* Proficiency in CRM tools (e.g., HubSpot, Zoho) and sales analytics platforms.
* **Mindset:**
* Results\-driven with a strong sense of ownership.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to think strategically and execute effectively.

**Perks and Benefits:**

* Competitive monthly salary of ₦250000 \- ₦ 300000
* Remote work flexibility.
* Opportunity to work with a global team and build a strong portfolio in international markets.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: ₦250,000\.00 \- ₦300,000\.00 per month

Experience:

* Business Development: 3 years (Preferred)

title: Waiter/Sales Rep
description:
Jollofsquare is a vibrant fast\-food restaurant specializing in delicious and quick meals for our esteemed customers. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service and ensuring customer satisfaction through efficient and timely order processing.

**Job Description:** We're seeking a dedicated and efficient Waiter/Sales Rep to join our team. The primary responsibility of this role is to process online orders both from our walk\-in customers as well as our partnering food delivery platforms, ensuring that each order is accurately prepared and promptly delivered to customers. The ideal candidate will be detail\-oriented, have excellent communication skills, and be able to work in a fast\-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Efficiently process online orders from various food delivery platforms.
* Verify and confirm order details to ensure accuracy.
* Coordinate with the kitchen staff to ensure timely preparation of orders.
* Package and prepare orders for delivery.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area.
* Provide exceptional customer service and address any order\-related inquiries or issues.
* Assist in inventory management and restocking as needed.
* Adhere to all health and safety regulations.

**Qualifications:**

* OND (Ordinary National Diploma) or NCE (National Certificate in Education).
* Prior experience in a fast\-food restaurant or similar environment is an advantage.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast\-paced environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Basic computer skills and familiarity with online ordering systems.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends.

**Available Locations**: Apete, Mokola, Agbowo and Ashi

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary, staff meals and other benefits.
* Opportunity for growth and career advancement within the company.
* A dynamic and supportive work environment.
* Training and development programs.

Job Types: Full\-time, Permanent

Pay: ₦60,000\.00 per month

Application Question(s):

* Where do you live in Ibadan?

Application Deadline: 30/03/2025

description:

**Data Analyst**
================

-----------------

Ibadan \& Oyo State Full Time
Agriculture, Fishing \& Forestry NGN 150,000 \- 250,000
 Easy Apply
### **Job Summary**

We are looking to add a Data Analyst to our team. One who is a self\-motivated professional with analysis and reporting capabilities for promoting services that will empower farmers. Our Data Analyst utilizes technical expertise to ensure that the data being tracked is accurate and high\-quality.


* Minimum Qualification : Degree
* Experience Level : Entry level
* Experience Length : 2 years
* Working Hours : Full Time
### **Job Description/Requirements**

**Responsibilities:**

* Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources
* Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format
* Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data
* Filter data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
* Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
* Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over some time
* Removing corrupted data and making recommendations for fixing coding errors and related problems
* Analyzing local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
* Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
* Working with programmers, software engineers, and team leads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies
* Preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders to understand the data\-analysis steps, enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends
Other relevant tasks as assigned to the employee.  
* 

  

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a Data Analyst.
* Excellent analytic skills
* Intuitive and proactive skills
* Technical expertise regarding data models, database design and development, data mining, and segmentation techniques especially on Metabase.
* Attention to detail
* Problem\-solving skills
* Time\-management skills
* Basic programming experience with frameworks, including Python and SQL.
* Interpersonal skills.
* Good written and verbal communication.
* Good at queries, report writing, and presenting findings to stakeholders.

### **Job Description/Requirements**

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

**Company Description**  



NEWAGE Farms is an agricultural company based in Nigeria specializing in commercial farming, food manufacturing, and trading of produce and commodities. The company is dedicated to innovative farming practices and ensuring a steady supply of quality agricultural products. NEWAGE Farms focuses on enhancing productivity and sustainability within the agriculture sector.  

  



**Role Description**  



This is a full\-time, on\-site role for an Agribusiness Manager located in Ibadan. The Agribusiness Manager will oversee daily farm operations, manage irrigation systems, and ensure best practices in farm management. Responsibilities include planning and coordinating farm activities, supervising staff, managing budgets, and developing strategies to enhance productivity and profitability. The role also involves monitoring market trends and ensuring compliance with agricultural regulations.  

  



**Qualifications**  



* Experience in Farm Management, including planning and coordination of farm activities
* Knowledge of Agriculture practices and management
* Familiarity with Irrigation systems and techniques
* Proficiency in managing Poultry operations
* Strong leadership and supervisory skills
* Excellent analytical and problem\-solving abilities
* Ability to work effectively in a team\-oriented environment
Bachelor's degree in Agriculture, Agribusiness, or related field  
*

title: Research Supervisor
description:
Today
I
**Research Supervisor**
=======================

**International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA)**
----------------------------------------------------------

**Research, Teaching \& Training**
----------------------------------

Ibadan \& Oyo State
Confidential
* Minimum Qualification :
### **Job Description/Requirements**

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

The International Institute of Tropical Agriculture seeks suitable Nigeria nationals for the position below at the Institute's headquarters in Ibadan:  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

**Position: Research Supervisor**  

  

**Contract: 3\-year renewable contract**  

  

**Location: Ibadan**  

  

**Closing Date: 31 March 2025**  

  

**DUTIES:**  

  



* Supervise all field research activities for Striga resistance and nutrient environment breeding programs, including Striga seed collection, field layout and infestation fertilizer application, planting data collection and harvest.
* Supervise screening in the laboratory and screen\-house using various specialized techniques. Assist in implementing new screening methods and prepare samples for genotyping.
* Supervise handling of Striga and nutrient enriched maize germplasm in the breeding nursery, including planting, hand\-pollinations, and data collection. Assist in making selections.
* Supervise junior staff and casual labour, assist in data collection and analysis, and in managing special projects.
* Assist in carrying out effective screening to transfer an Imazapyt Resistance (IR) gene into the lowland adapted maize germplasm.
* Assist graduate students on research projects as required.
* Assist the scientist to maintain strict control of budget expenditures and casual employment.
Perform any other duties as may be assigned by the Supervisor  
* 

**Requirements**  

  

**QUALIFICATION:**  

  

BSc/HND in Agriculture, Plant Science or any related field with a minimum of two (2\) years' experience performing similar role in a well\-structured environment.
  

  

**COMPETENCIES:**  

  

The ideal candidate must:  

  

  



* Have experience in the management of Screen House.
* Be able to lead in the preparation for Samples Analysis.
* Be able to lead in all Data collection process.
Have experience in management of Cold Store  
* 

**Benefits**  

  

We offer highly competitive salary with equally attractive benefits and excellent working conditions in a pleasant campus environment.

* Supervise the team of engineers to design, develop, and deploy the right interfaces and technologies to make solutions accessible to multiple groups
* Contribute innovative solutions and ideas to increase organizational efficiency and profitability through technology
* Focus on the end\-user experience while ensuring that designs are resilient
* Analyze current solution designs to provide design improvements to handle the growth of the business
* Test and evaluate new and existing products to ensure that they meet the needs of the business and the end user
* Write and implement efficient, clean, and easy\-to\-read code;Deploy software tools, processes, and metrics to ensure that the software is reliable and scalable
* Collaborate with other developers to create and manage repositories
* Maintain and upgrade existing systems to ensure that they are up\-to\-date and secure
* Ensure bugs are fixed promptly to reduce the likelihood of downtime
* Support users in training on how to use the software to its full potential

Other relevant duties as may arise and may be assigned to the employee  
* 

  

**Requirements:*** Experience in developing and maintaining software features and services that support the functional requirements for business applications.
* Previous experience deploying and maintaining software on cloud infrastructure.
* Ability to enhance team collaboration while working with cross\-functional teams.
* A technical mindset with great attention to detail.
* Familiarity using the required technologies such as Git, GitHub, Heroku, Docker, VS Code, and Google Cloud Platform, Postman.
* Experience with the relevant software and technologies needed for team engagement \- Google Workspace, Clickup, Figma.

**BAT is evolving at pace into a global multi\-category business. We are on a mission to decrease the health impact of our industry.**  

  

**To achieve our ambition, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to Be The Change. Come, join us on this journey!**  

  

**British American Tobacco** **Nigeria has an exciting opportunity for a Maintenance Coordinator in Ibadan**  

  

The maintenance coordinator drives executing of maintenance, eliminating breakdown losses at the lowest cost stringently following the MP\&S and BDE processes. The individual is responsible for building capability in Operating and technical teams, ensures that technical resources are available (spares, tools, manuals etc) supporting to deliver the overall line results in line with the Compelling Business Needs.
  

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include**  

  



* Ensure maintenance plan is prepared and circulated, and no MO is open after maintenance execution.
* Regular review of maintenance task list to spur improvements following SIMPTWW.
* Manage and monitor the respective DMSs driving 100% employee involvement, and zero loss mind set ensuring no repetitive breakdown
* Ensure the revision and updating of “Maintenance Technical Documentation” occurs as necessary focusing on spare usage, inventory and maintenance cost reduction.
* Drive to improve and sustain standard product quality level.
Regular engagement with operating team, supports IWS phase progression in all the required areas.  
* 

**What are we looking for?**  

  



* First degree or HND in engineer with minimum of 2nd class or upper credit – mandatory.
* At least 5 years of experience in relevant field (tobacco industry is an advantage).
* SAP knowledge – mandatory.
* Good knowledge of IWS and process is required.
* Good knowledge of the technical operations of GD packing and making machines is an added advantage.
Good communication and collaboration skills.  
* 

What we offer you?  

  

  



* We offer a market leading annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility)
* Our range of benefits varies by country and includes diverse health plans, initiatives for work\-life balance, transportation support, and a flexible holiday plan with additional incentives
* Your journey with us isn't limited by boundaries; it's propelled by your aspirations. Join us at BAT and become a part of an environment that thrives on internal advancement, where your career progression isn't just a statement – it's a reality we're eager to build together. Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.
* You'll have access to online learning platforms and personalized growth programs to nurture your leadership skills
We prioritise continuous improvement within a transformative environment, preparing for ongoing changes  
* 

**WHY JOIN BAT?**  

  

**We’re one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute – certified in offering excellent employee conditions.**  

  

**Collaboration, inclusion and partnership underpin everything we do here at BAT. We are looking forward to enabling every individual to thrive, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio\-economic and professional background, veteran status, perspectives and thinking styles. We know that embracing talent from all backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals.**  

  

**We see the career breaks as opportunities not obstacles. Through The Global Returners program, we support professionals looking to restart their careers after an extended absence from the workforce (e.g. time out caring for family, parental leave, national service, sabbatical and/or starting an own venture).**  

  

**Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience here.**

* Lead and attend to all maker Projects and NPI and deliver all related initiatives.
* Lead all maker training and assessment for both operators and technician and also involved in the technical coaching \& development of maker technicians.
Work with Maintenance Leads and other stake holders to provide innovative solution to all making Machine problems.

* At least 8 years of experience in running and maintaining 121 cigarette making machines – mandatory.

title: Van Sales Representative
description:
**Job Title**: Van Sales Representative

**Location:** Ibadan

**Industry:** Beverages

**Overview:**

We are looking for a dedicated and results\-driven Van Sales Representative to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of one year of van sales experience in the FMCG (Beverages) sector and a strong commitment to achieving sales targets. This role is essential for driving product availability and visibility in both wholesale and retail outlets across Nigeria.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Deliver on monthly sales targets consistently to drive revenue growth.
* Ensure our products are available in wholesale and retail outlets at levels comparable to our main competitors.
* Collaborate with dealers and retailers to activate our products effectively at the point of sale.
* Opportunity Development: Identify, create, and execute sales opportunities with dealers and retailers to increase sell\-in and sell\-out.
* Customer Acquisition: Identify and recruit new wholesale and retail customers to expand our market presence.
* Cash Remittance: Remit all cash collected on behalf of dealers without fail, ensuring accurate financial transactions.
* Stock Reconciliation: Perform daily reconciliation of dealer stocks sold through redistribution to maintain accurate records.
* Competitor Monitoring: Monitor and report on competitor activities, including trade and consumer pricing, promotional schemes, and new product launches.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum Qualification: OND (Ordinary National Diploma) or equivalent.
* Minimum of 1 year of van sales experience in the FMCG industry.
* Good driving skills with an active driving license/permit and a solid knowledge of Nigerian roads.
* Ability to use smartphones and familiarity with sales applications.

**Method of Application**  
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: **cv@ascentech.com.ng** using the “Job Title” and “Location” as the subject of the mail

Pay: ₦150,000\.00 \- ₦190,000\.00 per month

title: STEM Instructor | Grades 1-12 (Lagos & Ibadan)
description:
Yesterday
T
**STEM Instructor \| Grades 1\-12 (Lagos \& Ibadan)**
=====================================================

**Talent Code Africa**
----------------------

Ibadan \& Oyo State
Confidential
* Minimum Qualification :
### **Job Description/Requirements**

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

Job Description:  



  

The STEM Instructor specializing in Coding and Robotics will teach students in grades 1 through 12 how to design, build, and program robots, as well as develop foundational coding skills. The role combines hands\-on robotics instruction with coding concepts to foster critical thinking, problem\-solving, and collaboration skills in students. This instructor will provide a dynamic, engaging, and inclusive learning environment that encourages students to explore STEM fields, work with technology, and prepare for future careers in robotics, engineering, and computer science.  



  

Key Responsibilities:  



  

1\. Coding and Robotics Instruction: o Design and teach lessons that introduce and develop coding concepts (e.g., programming languages like Scratch, Python, JavaScript, or block\-based coding) for students in grades 1\-12\. o Guide students in using various robotics platforms and kits (e.g., LEGO Mindstorms, VEX Robotics, Arduino, Raspberry Pi) to build and program robots. o Encourage hands\-on, project\-based learning where students create functional robots, code interactive programs, and solve real\-world engineering challenges. o Provide opportunities for students to participate in robotics competitions (e.g., FIRST LEGO League, VEX Robotics competitions) and other coding\-related events.  



  

2\. Curriculum Development \& Lesson Planning: o Develop lesson plans that aligns with both national and state STEM education standards, with a focus on coding and robotics. o Create lesson plans that gradually increase in complexity to cater to students’ developmental stages, from simple coding tasks in elementary school to advanced robotics and algorithm development in high school. o Design and implement differentiated learning strategies to meet the needs of students at different skill levels and learning styles.  



  

3\. Project\-Based Learning \& Problem Solving: o Facilitate collaborative, hands\-on projects where students work in teams to build and program robots to solve specific challenges (e.g., robot races, obstacle courses). o Promote creative problem\-solving by encouraging students to troubleshoot, iterate, and improve their designs and code. o Use real\-world scenarios to contextualize coding and robotics concepts, such as automation, artificial intelligence, and engineering design processes.  



  

4\. Student Assessment \& Feedback: o Assess student progress through coding exercises, robot\-building projects, quizzes, and project presentations. o Provide personalized feedback to help students improve their coding and robotics skills. o Track individual and group progress, adjusting instruction to ensure all students are challenged and supported.  



  

5\. Classroom Management \& Environment: o Create a positive, inclusive, and collaborative classroom environment where students feel confident in experimenting and learning from mistakes. o Implement classroom management strategies to keep students engaged, focused, and respectful of the tools and equipment. o Ensure a safe and organized learning environment, particularly in managing robotics kits, electronics, and computers. 6\. Extracurricular Engagement: o Lead or support after\-school coding clubs, robotics teams, or hackathons to provide students with additional opportunities to practice and showcase their skills. o Organize and mentor students for local, regional, or national robotics competitions and coding challenges. 7\. Professional Development \& Collaboration: o Stay current with trends and best practices in coding, robotics, and STEM education through workshops, conferences, and online resources. o Collaborate with fellow STEM instructors to integrate robotics and coding concepts into other subject areas (e.g., math, science). o Share innovative teaching strategies and resources with colleagues to improve the school’s overall STEM curriculum.  



  

Qualifications: • Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Robotics, Education, or a related field required. A Master’s degree or specialized certifications in coding, robotics, or STEM education is a plus. • Certifications: Teaching certification for grades 1\-12, or equivalent depending on the region (e.g., state certification) is required. •  



  

Experience: Prior teaching experience in coding, robotics, or STEM subjects in a K\-12 setting is preferred. o Familiarity with various robotics platforms (LEGO, VEX, Arduino, etc.) and coding languages (Scratch, Python, Java, etc.) is essential. o Experience in organizing and mentoring students for coding competitions or robotics tournaments is beneficial. •  



  

Skills: Strong knowledge of coding principles, robotics design, and programming languages. o Ability to explain complex coding and robotics concepts to students of all ages and skill levels. o Strong communication, problem\-solving, and organizational skills. o Ability to integrate technology into lesson plans and student activities. o Passion for inspiring students to explore STEM fields and develop coding and robotics skills.

title: Making Specialist
description:
**BAT is evolving at pace into a global multi\-category business. We are on a mission to decrease the health impact of our industry**  

**To achieve our ambition, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to Be The Change. Come, join us on this journey**

 **British American Tobacco** **Nigeria has an exciting opportunity for a Making Specialist in Ibadan**

  

The making specialist will strategically prevent equipment (GD 121 and Ancillaries) forced deterioration, reducing maintenance cost, and develop operating teams’ capability to ensure that equipment is always maintained at base condition following all the SWP enshrined in IWS.

 **Your key responsibilities will include:**

* Ensure that all making machines on the floor runs optimally and consistently all the time.
* Develop database of tracking spares consumption and ensure that there is availability of necessary spares to keep making machine running all the time thereby reducing downtime associated with stock out of spares.
* Support in deploying sound maintenance practices, ensuring that inventory is maintained at a very low level, product quality and waste is at the right standards.
* Lead and attend to all maker Projects and NPI and deliver all related initiatives.
* Lead all maker training and assessment for both operators and technician and also involved in the technical coaching \& development of maker technicians.
* Work with Maintenance Leads and other stake holders to provide innovative solution to all making Machine problems.

 **What are we looking for?**

* At least 8 years of experience in running and maintaining 121 cigarette making machines – mandatory.
* Minimum Engineering degree or HND is required with 2nd class upper or upper credit respectively – mandatory.
* SAP knowledge represents an advantage.
* Strong technical and maintenance skills.
* Communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills.

 **What we offer you?**  

* We offer a market leading annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility)
* Our range of benefits varies by country and includes diverse health plans, initiatives for work\-life balance, transportation support, and a flexible holiday plan with additional incentives
* Your journey with us isn't limited by boundaries; it's propelled by your aspirations. Join us at BAT and become a part of an environment that thrives on internal advancement, where your career progression isn't just a statement – it's a reality we're eager to build together. Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.
* You'll have access to online learning platforms and personalized growth programs to nurture your leadership skills
* We prioritise continuous improvement within a transformative environment, preparing for ongoing changes
 **WHY JOIN BAT?**  

We’re one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute – certified in offering excellent employee conditions.  

  

At BAT, we champion collaboration, inclusion, and partnership as the bedrock of our values. We wish to foster an environment where every individual can thrive, irrespective of factors such as gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio\-economic and professional background, as well as diverse perspectives and thinking styles. We recognise that our strength lies in embracing talent from all walks of life, empowering us to develop our culture of inclusivity and better achieve our business objectives.  

  

We view career breaks not as obstacles but as opportunities and encourage everyone, without hesitation, to apply. Through our Global Returners program, we provide support to professionals seeking to re\-enter the workforce after an extended absence, be it for family care, parental leave, national service, sabbatical, or starting their own venture.  

Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience here.  

  

We take pride in being a Disability Confident Employer. If you need any reasonable adjustments or accommodations to be made during the recruitment process to support you performing at your best, please inform the recruitment partner who will be in touch should your profile be selected for the role you applied for. We are wholeheartedly committed to optimising your prospects of success by making suitable arrangements so that you may showcase your full potential.

title: Maintenance Coordinator
description:
**BAT is evolving at pace into a global multi\-category business. We are on a mission to decrease the health impact of our industry.**  

**To achieve our ambition, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to Be The Change. Come, join us on this journey!**

 **British American Tobacco** **Nigeria has an exciting opportunity for a Maintenance Coordinator in Ibadan**

  

The maintenance coordinator drives executing of maintenance, eliminating breakdown losses at the lowest cost stringently following the MP\&S and BDE processes. The individual is responsible for building capability in Operating and technical teams, ensures that technical resources are available (spares, tools, manuals etc) supporting to deliver the overall line results in line with the Compelling Business Needs.

* Ensure maintenance plan is prepared and circulated, and no MO is open after maintenance execution.

* Manage and monitor the respective DMSs driving 100% employee involvement, and zero loss mind set ensuring no repetitive breakdown
* Ensure the revision and updating of “Maintenance Technical Documentation” occurs as necessary focusing on spare usage, inventory and maintenance cost reduction.
* Drive to improve and sustain standard product quality level.
* Regular engagement with operating team, supports IWS phase progression in all the required areas.

 **What are we looking for?**

* First degree or HND in engineer with minimum of 2nd class or upper credit – mandatory.
* At least 5 years of experience in relevant field (tobacco industry is an advantage).
* SAP knowledge – mandatory.
* Good knowledge of IWS and process is required.
* Good knowledge of the technical operations of GD packing and making machines is an added advantage.
* Good communication and collaboration skills.

Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.**

**We’re one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute – certified in offering excellent employee conditions.**  

  

**Collaboration, inclusion and partnership underpin everything we do here at BAT. We are looking forward to enabling every individual to thrive, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio\-economic and professional background, veteran status, perspectives and thinking styles. We know that embracing talent from all backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals.**

Through The Global Returners program, we support professionals looking to restart their careers after an extended absence from the workforce (e.g. time out caring for family, parental leave, national service, sabbatical and/or starting an own venture).**  

  

**Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience** **here****.**

title: Business Development Executive
description:
**Job Title: Business Development Executive**

**Job Type:** Full time

**Location:** Remote

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* **120\-Day Trial Period:** During this period, your performance will be evaluated based on lead generation and customer acquisition.
* **Performance Benchmark:** To be eligible for a full\-time role, you must acquire at least four new customers within the 120\-day trial period.
* **Compensation During Trial:** While in the trial period, you will only receive 15% of the revenue generated from closed sales deals. There will not be any fixed salary but just 15% of the revenue generated from the deal you close (This is recurring as long as the client continues to work with us and pays invoices).
* **Post\-Trial Compensation:** Upon successful completion of the trial period and meeting the customer acquisition target, you will be eligible for a full\-time role with a fixed salary (range ₦250000 \- ₦ 300000\) plus the 15% revenue sharing from closed sales deals will continue even after the trial period.

**About Us:** Metricoid Technology Solutions is a leading software development company specializing in web, mobile, and AI applications. With over 14 years of experience and a global client base, we provide innovative and cost\-effective solutions to startups and enterprises. We are seeking a **Business Development Executive (BDE)** to lead our efforts in acquiring new clients, driving growth, and expanding our presence in the USA and EU markets.

**Role Overview:**

The Business Development Executive will take **end\-to\-end ownership** of our business growth efforts, including strategizing, leading the team, and directly engaging with potential clients. This role requires a proactive leader who can devise strategies, oversee execution, and deliver measurable results in terms of client acquisition and revenue growth.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Strategy Development:**
* Develop and implement a business development strategy targeting USA and EU markets.
* Identify new market opportunities, industries, and client segments.
* **Lead Generation and Client Acquisition:**
* Drive inbound and outbound lead generation through campaigns, networking, and partnerships.
* Build and nurture relationships with potential clients, from initial contact to deal closure.
* **Team Leadership:**
* Manage and mentor a team of marketing and lead generation specialists.
* Ensure alignment between team efforts and business goals.
* **Execution and Accountability:**
* Own the entire sales funnel—from lead generation to closing deals.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a smooth client onboarding process.
* **Market Insights and Reporting:**
* Conduct market research to stay ahead of industry trends and competitors.
* Provide regular updates and reports on progress, challenges, and recommendations.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**
* Minimum **3\+ years of experience** in business development, sales, or a similar leadership role, preferably in a software development or IT services company.
* Proven track record of successfully closing deals in international markets (USA/EU preferred).
* **Skills:**
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship\-building abilities.
* Deep understanding of software development services (AI/ML, MVPs, SaaS, etc.).
* Proficiency in CRM tools (e.g., HubSpot, Zoho) and sales analytics platforms.
* **Mindset:**
* Results\-driven with a strong sense of ownership.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to think strategically and execute effectively.

**Perks and Benefits:**

* Competitive monthly salary of ₦250000 \- ₦ 300000
* Remote work flexibility.
* Opportunity to work with a global team and build a strong portfolio in international markets.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: ₦250,000\.00 \- ₦300,000\.00 per month

Experience:

* Business Development: 3 years (Preferred)

description:

**Resident Engineer**
=====================

-------------------------------------

-----------------------------

Ibadan \& Oyo State Full Time
IT \& Telecoms NGN 75,000 \- 150,000
 Easy Apply
### **Job Summary**

The Resident Engineer is responsible for providing on\-site technical support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of network infrastructure at a designated client location. This role ensures network stability, high availability, and optimal performance of the ISP’s services, working closely with both internal teams and the client’s IT department.


* Minimum Qualification : HND
* Experience Level : Entry level
* Experience Length : 1 year
* Working Hours : Full Time
### **Job Description/Requirements**

**Responsibilities:**

  

**Network Monitoring \& Maintenance:**

* Continuously monitor network performance, uptime, and service quality at the client’s site.
* Identify, diagnose, and resolve network faults, latency issues, and service disruptions.
Perform routine maintenance, software upgrades, and patch management on networking equipment.  
* 

  

**Technical Support \& Troubleshooting:**

* Provide first\-line and second\-line support for all network\-related issues at the client’s location.
* Handle fiber, microwave, and wired network troubleshooting, including CPE configurations.
Work with the NOC (Network Operations Center) to resolve escalated issues and ensure minimal downtime.  
* 

  

**Installation \& Configuration:**

* Deploy and configure routers, switches, firewalls, and other network devices.
* Conduct fiber splicing, termination, and testing where required.
Ensure proper installation and documentation of all network components.  
* 

  

**Client Relationship Management:**

* Act as the primary technical contact for the client, ensuring prompt issue resolution and satisfaction.
* Maintain clear communication and regular status updates with the client’s IT team.
Provide guidance on network optimization and best practices.  
* 

  

**Documentation \& Reporting:**

* Maintain accurate incident logs, service reports, and network diagrams.
* Generate weekly/monthly reports on network performance, issues, and resolutions.
* Document all troubleshooting steps and solutions for future reference.
Prepare and submit network monitoring and uptime report  
* 

  

**Requirements:**

* At least 1 year of experience
* HND in a relevant course of study

title: Internal Auditor
description:
* We are seeking a detail\-oriented Internal Auditor to assess, develop, and enhance our audit processes.
* The ideal candidate will conduct company\-wide audits, analyze financial and operational data, and ensure compliance with internal policies and industry standards.
* This role requires a high level of integrity, analytical skills, and a proactive approach to risk management.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Assist in the development and implementation of audit processes and best practices.
* Conduct internal audits across various company departments and locations.
* Prepare detailed audit reports with findings, risks, and recommendations.
* Implement and execute audit program reviews in line with industry standards.
* Identify process gaps, inefficiencies, and fraud risks, providing strategic solutions.
* Participate in audit discussions, presenting findings to management.
* Assist in the development of annual internal audit plans to strengthen controls.
* Utilize data analytics to detect and prevent fraud or internal theft.


**Qualifications \& Skills**


* Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
* 3\-6 years of experience in internal/external auditing, preferably in a Big 4 audit firm (Deloitte, EY, KPMG, PwC).
* Certified Internal Auditor (CIA) certification is highly preferred.
* Strong knowledge of audit standards, risk assessment, and compliance procedures.
* Excellent analytical, problem\-solving, and report\-writing skills.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and financial software.
* High level of integrity, objectivity, and professional skepticism.


**Salary**  

N500,000 \- N900,00 monthly.


**Method of Application**  

Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:**akinleye@globalprofilers.com**using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.


**Note:** This position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to a growing organization, ensuring compliance, risk mitigation, and financial integrity.

title: Construction Engineer (Oyo State, Nigeria)
description:
**Position Overview:**

The Construction Engineer (Expansion) is the owner of the process of service location acquisition, renovations and installation in our expansion process into new sites. The Construction Engineer finds suitable service locations, negotiates, leases, procure equipment, renovates, installs, audits and signs off on those allocated sites according to our company’s predefined standards.

**Accountabilities:**

* Own the acquisition, construction, renovation and installation process for approved sites identified in our expansion pipeline by ensuring 100% compliance with the acquisition, construction, renovations and installation process.
* Own and manage sourcing and contracting of vendors for all activities of construction, renovation of a shop or installation of a hub, including management of materials, tools and equipment used.
* Own and audit the work completion per allocated site according to defined standards.

Responsibilities

* Assess approved sites and identify suitable services locations, shops / plots of land for leasing that meet our defined standards.
* Manage the lease or acquisition of shops or plot of land that meet our service location criteria.
* Assess the acquired service location and identify preparations or renovations requirements.
* Manage the sourcing of appropriate furniture producing factories/contractors that meet the set criteria to produce Jaza furniture and install hubs across allocated sites.
* Request, procure, take delivery and document required items, tools and equipment needed for the completion of the work.
* Ensure availability of furniture across allocated regions/sites undergoing Expansion to ensure there are no delays in the set timelines.
* Monitor renovations and construction needs and constantly reports need for tools, materials and equipment with reference to the set targets across allocated locations undergoing Expansion
* Manage quality checklists and ensure that they are adhered to in the process of acquisition, renovation and construction.
* Work effectively with engineers, supply chain, and other construction teams, ensuring seamless integration between different parts of the project.
* Document and report milestones reached during this process.

**Requirements**

* A relevant degree in construction management, civil engineering or a related field.
* Deep Understanding of the overall construction process, including shop or land negotiation, leasing and acquisition, renovation, site preparation, furnishing and foundation work, and structural assembly.
* Ability to interpret blueprints and design specifications, especially for our customized hubs, ensuring they meet both the structural and electrical needs for solar installations.
* Ability to think critically and come up with solutions for unique or complex construction challenges, particularly when working with already built shops.
* Good data collection, analytical, and reporting skills.
* Ability to commit to high level quality standards.
* Clear communication skills to interact with suppliers, contractors, and other stakeholders and explain complex technical concepts in simple terms.
* Ability to work independently, interact with people of different backgrounds, cultures, languages and to travel frequently to remote locations.

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: ₦150,000\.00 \- ₦180,000\.00 per month

title: Sales Representative
description:
KyDAL Office Point (KOP) is a world\-class organization that offers a wide range of solutions for effective and high performance of co\-operate setups. We offer tangible supplies for smooth and effective office operations as well as strategic support for high performance and maximum output of personnel by delivering best\-practice HRM systems and training solutions. Our customized solutions are focused on helping organizations optimize the potential of their people \- their Primary Asset while providing work tools that maximize output and productivity.


We are recruiting to fill the position below:  

  

**Job Position: Sales Representative**


**Job Location:** Ibadan, Oyo  

Employment Type: Full\-time  



  

**Responsibilities**  

Customer Engagement:


* Reaching out to potential and existing customers through various channels (calls, emails, in\-person meetings) to understand their needs and present tailored solutions.

Product/Service Knowledge:


* Maintaining a thorough understanding of the company's products or services, including features, benefits, and how they address customer needs.

Presentations and Demonstrations:


* Delivering compelling presentations and product demonstrations to showcase the value proposition and persuade customers to make a purchase.

Negotiation and Closing:


* Negotiating prices, terms, and conditions, and closing sales deals to achieve revenue targets.

Relationship Building:


* Building and maintaining strong relationships with customers to foster loyalty and encourage repeat business.

Follow\-up and Customer Service:


* Following up with customers after a sale to ensure satisfaction, address any issues, and build long\-term relationships.

Sales Reporting and Forecasting:


* Maintaining accurate records of sales activities, tracking performance against targets, and providing insights for sales forecasting.

Collaboration:


* Working effectively with other departments (marketing, customer service, etc.) to ensure a positive customer experience.

Lead Generation and Qualification:


* Identifying potential customers and qualifying them as viable prospects.

**Salary**  

N60,000 \- N80,000 / month.


**Method of Application**  

Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application to: **info@kydalofficepoint.com** using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Solar PV Installation Engineer (Oyo State, Nigeria)
description:
**Position Overview:**

The Solar Installation Engineer (Expansion) is the owner of the Technical operations involved in the Expansion process into new sites. The Expansion Tech reports to the QA Tech Operations and works to ensure that our service locations have commissioning and installation of solar technical equipment completed to the pre\-defined standards.

**Accountabilities:**

* Own the technical commissioning process for our service locations by ensuring 100% compliance with the commissioning process.
* Own and manage all tech activities, equipment and tools used in the commissioning process for new sites.
* Own and audit the work completion per allocated site according to defined standards.

**Responsibilities:**

* Prepare a predeparture checklist of required items, tools and technical equipment for the commissioning of allocated sites.
* Commission and install solar technical equipment at allocated sites by ensuring that all set processes according to the commissioning guidelines and documentations are accurately done and completed.
* Ensure proper set up of new sites in the Star App, Dashboard and Dataverse before handing the site over to the regional tech.
* Accurately file, respond to, update, and escalate technical issues in Gitlab.
* Remotely troubleshoot and resolve Hub performance issues pre\-golive. Travel to Hubs to resolve issues requiring in\-person troubleshooting/repairs, for sites still under Expansion.
* Ensure availability of working Jaza packs for Go\-live by checking charge rate.
* Ensure 100% connectivity at new sites.
* Keep accurate records of Hub/Shop Equipment and product component inventory during the commissioning phase.
* Test new products and firmware as needed.
* Work effectively with regional tech, supply chain, and other construction teams, ensuring seamless integration between different parts of the project.
* Document and report milestones reached during this process.

**Requirements:**

* Background in Electrical/Electronics or any related field.
* PV system design and installation knowledge.
* Knowledge in electrical installation.
* Good data collection, analytical, reporting and communication skills.
* Ability to commit to high level quality standards.
* Ability to learn new technologies as required in the role.
* Ability to work independently, interact with people of different backgrounds, cultures, languages and to travel frequently to remote locations.

* Optimize websites for performance, SEO, and security.
* Ensure responsive design and cross\-browser compatibility.
* Implement color theory and UI/UX best practices to enhance visual aesthetics.
* Troubleshoot and fix bugs on existing websites.
* Work with e\-commerce platforms like WooCommerce for online store development.
* Deliver projects on time while maintaining high\-quality standards.
* Stay updated with the latest web technologies, design trends, and WordPress developments.

**Requirements \& Qualifications**

Proven experience as a front\-end developer with WordPress, PHP, CSS, and JavaScript.

Strong knowledge of WordPress theme and plugin customization.

Good understanding of UI/UX, color selection, and visual design principles.

Experience with WooCommerce, Elementor, Gutenberg, and third\-party API integrations.

Basic back\-end knowledge (handling database connections, troubleshooting PHP errors, etc.).

Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.

Strong problem\-solving skills and attention to detail.

Good communication and collaboration skills.

Must be able to work full\-time at our office.

**\*\*Please note that this position is on\-site\*\***

**How to Apply**

Interested candidates should send their CV, portfolio, and a short cover letter explaining why they are the right fit for this role to Teniola.a@pavictek.com with the subject: Job Application Front\-End Developer.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: ₦100,000\.00 \- ₦100,001\.00 per month

Application Deadline: 31/03/2025

title: Operator
description:
**BAT is evolving at pace into a global multi\-category business. With products like VELO, VUSE and GLO we are on a mission to decrease the health impact of our industry**

**To achieve our ambition, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to Be The Change. Come, join us on this journey!**

**British American Tobacco Nigeria has an exciting opportunity for two Operators in Ibadan**

  

To ensure production processes management and control over quality of manufactured products within a Making or/and Packing Machine.


Individual is responsible to insure their equipment is operated and maintained in basic conditions and improvements required to reach goals are executed. Train, coach, and give feedback to people to insure equipment is operated and maintained in accordance with agreed standards. Individual is member of the Operating (Autonomous Maintenance) Team.

 **Your key responsibilities will include:**

* Ensures daily production target are met in terms of volume.
* Coach and develop Technician Teams on Equipment standards (Safety maps; DMS execution etc.
* Monitor effectiveness and provide coaching
* Continuously improve standards to deliver target results
* Propose, execute, and document improvements to eliminate losses
* Recommend reapplication through Module AM Pillar owner and line structure.
* Propose, execute, and document improvements to eliminate losses
* Eliminate Root Cause of any outages relative to your equipment
* Lead issue resolution “to Root Cause” on the floor of chronic stops on your equipment

 **What are we looking for?**

* Bachelors of Science/Engineering from a recognized institution.
* Knowledge of any manufacturing environment with 0 – 3 years’ experience in a production environment
* Good interpersonal and communication skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Self\-leading role
* Familiarity with structured problem tools

 **What we offer you?**

* We offer a market leading annual performance bonus (subject to eligibility)
* Our range of benefits varies by country and includes diverse health plans, initiatives for work\-life balance, transportation support, and a flexible holiday plan with additional incentives
* Your journey with us isn't limited by boundaries; it's propelled by your aspirations. Join us at BAT and become a part of an environment that thrives on internal advancement, where your career progression isn't just a statement – it's a reality we're eager to build together. Seize the opportunity and own your development; your next chapter starts here.
* You'll have access to online learning platforms and personalized growth programs to nurture your leadership skills
* We prioritise continuous improvement within a transformative environment, preparing for ongoing changes

 **WHY JOIN BAT?**


We’re one of the few companies named as a Global Top Employer by the Top Employers Institute – certified in offering excellent employee conditions.


Collaboration, inclusion and partnership underpin everything we do here at BAT. We are looking forward to enabling every individual to thrive, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, skills, experience, education, socio\-economic and professional background, veteran status, perspectives and thinking styles. We know that embracing talent from all backgrounds is what makes us stronger and best prepared to meet our business goals.


We see the career breaks as opportunities not obstacles. Through The Global Returners program, we support professionals looking to restart their careers after an extended absence from the workforce (e.g. time out caring for family, parental leave, national service, sabbatical and/or starting an own venture).


Come bring your difference and see what is possible for you at BAT. Learn more about our culture and our award winning employee experience *here*.


If you require any reasonable adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best during the recruitment process, you are encouraged to notify us. We are fully committed to support you by making appropriate arrangements for you to demonstrate your full potential.

title: Geography Teacher
description:
**Job Overview**

As a Geography Teacher at our client's School, you will play a crucial role in shaping the future of our students by imparting knowledge of the world's physical and human environments. You will be responsible for creating an engaging and effective learning environment, delivering dynamic lessons, and helping students develop a deep understanding of geography.

**Job Location: Moniya (Proximity to this location is a core requirement).**

**Key Responsibilities:**

\* Develop and implement a curriculum that aligns with the Nigerian Senior Secondary School Geography curriculum.

\* Create a stimulating and interactive classroom atmosphere that encourages active student participation and engagement.

\* Deliver well\-structured lessons that cover various geographical topics, including physical geography, human geography, regional studies, and environmental issues.

\* Employ a variety of teaching methods, including lectures, group activities, discussions, and multimedia resources to cater to diverse learning styles.

\* Assess and evaluate student progress through quizzes, exams, projects, and assignments, and provide timely feedback.

\* Foster a strong understanding of geographical concepts, critical thinking skills, and geographic literacy in students.

\* Promote discussions on current events, geography\-related issues, and their relevance to society and the world.

**Qualifications:**

\* Bachelor's degree in Geography (Education) or HND in Urban and Regional Studies or a related field.

\* Teaching certification and relevant teaching experience is an added advantage.

\* Strong subject knowledge and a passion for geography education.

\* Excellent communication and classroom management skills.

\* Ability to create an inclusive and respectful learning environment.

\* Enthusiasm for professional development and staying current with educational trends and methodologies.

\* Familiarity with technology and its integration into the classroom for instructional purposes.

\* Adaptability, patience, and a commitment to the growth and success of students.

**How to Apply:** Interested candidates are invited to apply for this exciting position/opening using this link: bit.ly/picteachingjobs

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: From ₦60,000\.00 per month

Application Question(s):

title: Chemistry Teacher
description:
**Position: Chemistry Teacher**

**Location: Bodija, Ibadan (Proximity to any of these locations is very important)**

**Job Type: Full\-time**

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Chemistry Teacher to join our client's esteemed Senior Secondary School at **Bodija, Ibadan, Nigeria.** The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning and delivering engaging and effective chemistry lessons to students in the senior secondary level, fostering a love for the subject, and preparing them for success in national examinations. The Chemistry Teacher will play a pivotal role in nurturing our students' academic growth and personal development.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Curriculum Development:** Design and implement a comprehensive chemistry curriculum in accordance with the Nigerian senior secondary school system, incorporating both theoretical and practical components.

**Classroom Instruction:** Deliver well\-structured and engaging lessons, catering to diverse learning styles, and utilizing modern teaching techniques to ensure student understanding and retention.

**Laboratory Activities:** Conduct practical experiments to reinforce theoretical knowledge, emphasizing safety procedures and laboratory etiquette.

**Assessment and Evaluation:** Develop, administer, and grade tests, assignments, and examinations to gauge student progress and adjust teaching methods as necessary.

**Individualized Support:** Provide extra help and guidance to students who are struggling with chemistry concepts, and foster a supportive and inclusive classroom environment.

**Educational Resources:** Select and recommend textbooks, online resources, and other teaching materials to enhance the learning experience.

**Requirements:**

* A Bachelor's degree in Chemistry or a related field.
* Professional teaching certification is a plus.
* Minimum of 1 years of experience teaching Chemistry at the senior secondary level.
* Strong knowledge of the Nigerian senior secondary school curriculum and relevant examination bodies (e.g., WAEC, NECO).
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong classroom management skills and the ability to create a positive learning environment.
* Dedication to the academic and personal development of students.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment.
* Contribution to the education and development of young minds.

Interested candidates are invited to apply for this exciting opportunity by applying through this form link: https://forms.gle/TriFYpY8m6dmtHL58

title: Customer Loyalty / Recovery Officer
description:
* We are seeking a proactive Customer Loyalty \& Recovery Officer to drive customer retention performance in assigned region, monitor repayment trends and develop means to improve collection rates whilst maintaining excellent customer experience.
* The ideal candidate must have strong experience in debt recovery and good customer relationship management.


**Responsibilities**


* Analyze community portfolio and repayment trends to develop daily, weekly, and monthly collection strategies
* Conduct daily follow\-ups with PDMs and partners to monitor and improve customer repayments.
* Work closely with finance, data and customer service teams to optimize collection.
* Handle retrieval and manage difficult customer collection through established processes.
* Prepare and present regular reports on retention, repayment efforts, customer feedback and success rates to Line Manager
* Track repayments and provide updates to Line Manager on field interventions and customer insights.
* Quickly resolve customers’ concerns or complaints to ensure satisfaction towards improving collection rates in low\-performing LGAs or escalate to relevant stakeholders.
* Implement strategies to retain customers by communicating new offers, product updates or benefits.
* Champion collection processes to enhance customer satisfaction while ensuring timely repayments.
* Achieve retention targets, customers repayment scores, and other performance metrics as set by business.


**Requirements**

title: Site Validator (Oyo State)
description:
**Position Overview:** 

This role involves community data collection, concise report writing and analysis to identify remote locations that have energy/electrification access issues who can benefit from our solar battery rental services. The sites validated by the validator will be evaluated based on our company\-specific approval criteria. The ideal candidate should have an interest in data collection, analysis, report writing, interaction with rural or remote locations through frequent travels across the country.

**Responsibilities:**

1\. Site Assessment and Validation:

* Work closely with the QA Expansion/Growth Lead to create a pool of approved sites/communities within the region/country that would fit well with our solar battery rental business model
* Gather information on any ongoing and upcoming electrification projects that may potentially affect our business operations in any respective community/state/region.
* Conduct on\-site visits to assess potential locations and collect data based on our set approval standards.
* Identify suitable land or shop for our hub or shop installation, ensuring there is adequate space and structural suitability.

2\. Community Engagement:

* Engage with local leaders, community members, and stakeholders to understand local needs, expectations, and potential support for our solar projects.
* Facilitate discussions around the benefits of solar energy to ensure community buy\-in.

3\. Data Collection and Reporting:

* Collect and document site\-specific data, including GPS coordinates, photographs, community demographics, and infrastructure details.
* Recommend potential improvements or considerations for sites that do not meet all criteria.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelors degree or its equivalent in any relevant discipline
* Interest or experience in data collection, fieldwork or site evaluation
* Knowledge of rural or remote community needs, especially regarding energy access challenges.
* Knowledge of mapping tools, and data collection technologies.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for engaging with rural communities and stakeholders.
* Ability to work independently, interact with people of different backgrounds, cultures, languages and to travel frequently to remote locations
* Ability to collect data and produce clear, concise reports.

Job Type: Contract  
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: ₦100,000\.00 \- ₦150,000\.00 per month

title: Field Service Engineer (Oyo State, Nigeria)
description:
**Job Overview**

To support this rapid expansion, we're seeking highly skilled Field Service Engineers (FSE) who excel in powering and sustaining energy uptime. In this pivotal role, you'll be instrumental in managing technical operations and swiftly resolving issues at the regional level. As an FSE, your focus will be on maintaining robust technical systems to guarantee uninterrupted power at sites and optimal energy uptime at our hubs.

This role requires significant travel within Nigeria, as Jaza is expanding across the South\-West states, with 21 hubs currently located in Oyo State.

This role involves owning and managing energy uptime, optimizing system performance, troubleshooting and repairing technical issues, and driving continuous improvement through data analysis, reporting, and collaboration. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong technical/engineering background, capable of multitasking, taking initiative and working in a fast\-paced environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Ensure energy uptime and power availability at sites by monitoring the system and quickly diagnosing and solving technical issues.
* Support the setup of new hubs, ensure connectivity, and perform routine hub energy system maintenance. You will either travel to the hubs or remotely troubleshoot and resolve issues.
* Overseeing the installation and configuration of solar panels, electrical wiring, and associated equipment.
* Collaborate with Jaza Stars and the data team to diagnose and resolve technical challenges.
* Document field activities and keep accurate Hub Equipment and product component inventory records.
* Regularly prepare reports on hub health and other technical issues, to be submitted to the Regional Service Engineer.

Requirements:

* Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering or related field
* Proven expertise in and a deep understanding of installing or ensuring uptime of energy systems. Ideally, this includes work with both diesel and solar systems.
* Minimum of 2\-3 years of technical/engineering experience within the telecommunications/energy industry or related sectors. We are not particular about your educational background and are more concerned with how much hands\-on experience you have.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving skills with the ability to identify and implement solutions to complex technical challenges. Strong commitment to safety and compliance with HSE standards.

title: Medical Doctor
description:
Position: **General Practitioner (Medical Doctor)**

Location: Purple Ivy Medical Consultants, Ring Road, Ibadan

Employment Type: Full\-time

**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a highly skilled, knowledgeable, and compassionate General Practitioner to join Purple Ivy Medical Consultants. The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing comprehensive medical care to patients, diagnosing illnesses, prescribing treatments, and ensuring high\-quality patient care in a professional healthcare environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct patient consultations, assess symptoms, and diagnose medical conditions.
* Prescribe and administer treatments, medications, and vaccinations as required.
* Provide guidance on preventive healthcare measures and lifestyle changes.
* Monitor patient progress and adjust treatments accordingly.
* Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to provide holistic patient care.
* Maintain accurate medical records and ensure confidentiality.
* Handle emergency cases and provide critical care support when necessary.
* Stay up to date with medical advancements and best practices in healthcare.

**Requirements:**

* Must have completed NYSC with post\-NYSC experience.
* Strong clinical knowledge and diagnostic skills.
* Excellent communication and patient\-care abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast\-paced hospital environment.
* Must be compassionate, empathetic, and dedicated to patient well\-being.
* Strong teamwork and problem\-solving skills.

**Work Schedule:**

* Day Duty: Monday – Friday, 8 a.m. – 5 p.m.
* Night Duty: 5 p.m. – 8 a.m.
* Alternate Weekend Calls: Saturday/Sunday

**Compensation \& Benefits:**

* Salary: Negotiable based on experience.
* Accommodation is provided for the selected candidate.
* Additional benefits may apply.

Application Process:

Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and credentials for screening.

**Apply Now! Send CV to jobup234@gmail.com**

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: From ₦200,000\.00 per month

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Ibadan: Reliably commute or willing to relocate with an employer\-provided relocation package (Preferred)

Application Question(s):

* How many years of post\-NYSC experience do you have?
* Are you comfortable with the shift schedule, including night duties and alternate weekend calls?
